snippet: The city’s unemployment rate, which fell to 7.8 percent in January, is still significantly higher than the nation’s.
abstract: State Labor Department reports that New York City’s unemployment rate continues its long, gradual decline, falling below 8 percent for the first time in five years; city’s rate, which dropped to 7.8 percent in January, is still significantly higher than national unemployment rate.
lead_paragraph: The city’s unemployment rate, which fell to 7.8 percent in January, is still significantly higher than the nation’s.

headline.main: New York City’s Jobless Rate Drops to Lowest Level in 5 Years
headline.print_headline: City’s Jobless Rate Drops to Lowest in Five Years
